section: The duration of this Venture (the "Term") will begin on March 1, 2020 and continue in full force and effect until February 28, 2025, unless terminated earlier by mutual agreement of the Managers.
explanation: The term of the joint venture is defined with specific start and end dates. However, it also includes a clause that allows for early termination by mutual agreement of the 'Managers'. This introduces a potential contradiction because the agreement is between the 'Members,' not the 'Managers.' The power to terminate should reside with the Members. If the Managers can terminate, it undermines the Members' control and creates ambiguity.

section: The duration of this Venture (the "Term") will begin on March 1, 2020 and continue in full force and effect until February 28, 2025, unless terminated earlier by mutual agreement of the Managers.
explanation: The agreement states that the term is until February 28, 2025, however it also mentions that the agreement can be terminated by 'mutual agreement of the managers'. The word managers and members should be interchanged, as this is an agreement between members and not managers. This creates conflicting obligations.

section: The Managers will jointly decide major issues concerning the Venture. Where Managers are unable to reach agreement in deciding major issues, approval by a majority vote of the Managers will be required.
explanation: Section 11 states that the managers will jointly decide major issues, but then states that a majority vote of managers will be required. However, there is no clear definition of how many 'managers' there are and what the parameters of majority vote mean. This creates ambiguity.

section: The Managers will jointly decide major issues concerning the Venture. Where Managers are unable to reach agreement in deciding major issues, approval by a majority vote of the Managers will be required.
explanation: Section 11 states that the managers will jointly decide major issues, but then states that a majority vote of managers will be required. Section 7 states that there are two managers. What happens if they do not reach majority vote? There needs to be an alternate.

section: Capital Contributions may be amended from time to time, according to the requirements of the Venture, by decision of the Managers. Where Members' interests are affected, additional capital contributions (the "Additional Capital Contributions") must have the unanimous consent of the Managers.
explanation: Capital Contributions may be amended from time to time, according to the requirements of the Venture, by decision of the Managers, and that when the Members' interests are affected, additional capital contributions must have unanimous consent of the managers. It states that managers can alter the contributions of the members, however, managers and members are not interchangeable. The duties and power should fall upon the members and not the managers.
